content.text:
# Draft:Rabih War (1899–1901)

The Rabih War, also called the Franco-Rabih War, or the Campaign of/against Rabah, was a military conflict fought between France and the Bornu Empire, mainly caused by both sides launching raids into each other’s territory.
FranceKingdom of BaguirmiBornu loyalists
| commander1        = Rabih az-Zubayr
| commander2        =  Major Lamy Lt. Henri Bretonnet Solomon Braun Émile Gentil Paul Joalland René ReibellSanda Kura of BornoGaourang II of Bagirmi
| strength1         = 10,000 men(French sources)
| strength2         = 700 French soldiers800 Baguirmians
| casualties1       = 1,500–2,000 killed3,500 wounded(Including civilians)
| casualties2       = 359 killed181 wounded3 cannons captured
}}
